original_title: Solar power project at Sri Lanka airport
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Sri Lanka’s main airport, has started a 100 kilowatt solar power pilot project on the roof of its passenger terminal building, a statement by the government information department said.
Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited said it invested 19 million rupees for the project.
The power generation capacity is estimated to be 600 kilowatt hours per day, 18,000 kilowatt hours per month, and the energy generated will be enough to power 200 average homes in Sri Lanka.
“The entire project was designed and installed by the electrical engineering department and other engineering departments of Airports and Aviation Services,” the statement said.
Airports and Aviation Services plans to add another 1,800 kilowatts to the system next year.

BIA is one of the largest electricity consumers in Sri Lanka, and by end 2024 hopes to increase renewable energy production to 10% of its total energy consumption, the statement continued. (Colombo/Nove23/2023)
